properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 3 at 3:49AM EST until March 4 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Caribou ME
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 9
inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze expected. Winds
gusting as high as 35 mph Wednesday afternoon.

* WHERE...Northwest Aroostook County.

* WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 4 PM EST Wednesday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of
blowing snow Wednesday afternoon could significantly reduce
visibility and cause localized hazardous travel. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning and evening commute. Power
outages are possible.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of snow, sleet
and ice will make travel extremely dangerous.

The latest road conditions for Maine can be obtained by going to
newengland511.org.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 PM EST WEDNESDAY
